botanical_details.genus: Rosa can be deciduous or semi-evergreen shrubs or scrambling climbers, with usually thorny stems bearing compound pinnate leaves and solitary or clustered flowers. Flowers may be followed by showy red or purple fruits in some varieties.
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Bourbon roses are large, mostly repeat-flowering shrubs with dark foliage and large, cupped, fragrant double flowers; they are suitable for training as climbers

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in full sun with fertile, humus-rich, moist but well-drained soil. For best flowering apply a balanced fertiliser and mulch in late winter or early spring. Suitable for hedging
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by hardwood cuttings in autumn or by T-budding in summer
how_to_grow.pests: aphids, leafhoppers, glasshouse red spider mite, scale insects, caterpillars and rose leaf-rolling sawfly may be a problem. Deer and rabbits can cause damage
how_to_grow.diseases: May be affected by black spot, rose rust and powdery mildews
